subject: History
title: The Manor System
description: A quick, practical guide to The Manor System.

hook.text: In medieval Europe, 90% of people never traveled more than 25 miles from where they were born.

buildup.text: The manor was a self-sufficient world: fields, a mill, a church, and the lord's house at the center.

discovery.text: Peasants worked the lord's land in exchange for protection and a strip of land to feed their families.

twist.text: Serfs weren't slaves, but they couldn't leave. Their children inherited the same obligations forever.

climax.text: This system defined European life for nearly a thousand years. Escape was rare; acceptance was survival.

punchline.text: Most medieval lives began and ended in one village.

quiz.question: What was the key difference between serfs and slaves?
options: Serfs earned wages; slaves did not
Serfs were tied to land but not owned as property
There was no real difference between them
